options: On top of a trash heap
questions.explanation:
In a burning field.

	Dragon woke up in a burning field in the city of Chicago. An amnesiac, he is supported by a police officer named Frank Darling. With Darling's influence, Dragon becomes a police officer and helps the force deal with superfreaks, superpowered criminals. These events kicked off the series in the first issue of "Savage Dragon" in 1992.

questions.text: Before joining the police force, where did Dragon work?
questions.explanation:
A warehouse.

	When Darling tries to recruit Dragon for the Chicago police force, Dragon turns him down. Instead, he works and lives in a warehouse operated by Darling's cousin. Darling, in an act of desperation, pays criminals to threaten his cousin and influence Dragon to join. However, Darling's cousin is killed and the warehouse is demolished. These events happened in the first issue of "Savage Dragon".

Antonio Seghetti.

	Seghetti was defeated by the Dragon in issue #21. Prior to that, Seghetti had skinned the Dragon alive, impaled him on a church spire, and cut his hand off. Luckily, Dragon recovers and regenerates fairly rapidly. Seghetti was revealed to be OverLord in "Savage Dragon" #21.

questions.text: Dragon was assigned to lead the Freak Force, a collection of benign superfreaks who worked for the Chicago police department. Who was NOT a member of the team?
questions.explanation:
Hardware.

	Finding themselves saddled with rules and regulations, the Freak Force doesn't last that long. However, Dragon and Rapture began a romantic relationship, and the two come close to tying the knot. Dragon assumed command of the Freak Force in issue #5.

Image Comics.

	Image Comics was formed in 1992 by seven illustrators who craved greater creator control over their comic book characters. They have also published "Youngblood" and "Spawn", among other series. Erik Larsen became the publisher of Image Comics in 2004.

questions.text: After OverLord's death, who assumed control of Chicago's warring superfreak factions?
questions.explanation:
CyberFace.

	CyberFace was a member of the Vicious Circle under OverLord, and assumed control after his death. CyberFace is really Sebastian Khan, formerly OverLord's top scientist. CyberFace assumes control of the Vicious Circle in issue #26.

True.

	Rapture was a former prostitute who gained electrokinetic powers and became a superhero alongside Dragon. They had a son together, Malcolm, but Rapture died before the wedding day. She first appeared in "Savage Dragon" #4.

questions.text: What is the name of Dragon's first girlfriend?
questions.explanation:
Debbie Harris.

	Debbie stayed at Dragon's apartment overnight, and was killed the next morning by her ex-boyfriend Arnold Dimple. Debbie's mother harbored a long grudge toward Dragon for her daughter's death. These events happened in the first issue of the monthly series.

questions.text: When Dragon takes leave of his mental faculties and goes on a destructive rampage, which police officer is critically injured and ends up in the hospital?
questions.explanation:
Alex Wilde.

	Wilde is Dragon's partner of the Chicago Police Department and the two have a casual friendship. Although Wilde is put in the hospital for a while due to Dragon's destruction, she harbors no ill will toward her partner. Dragon went on his rampage in issue #15.

questions.text: After Dragon kills OverLord, where does he decide to spend his vacation time?
questions.explanation:
Disneyland.

	After finally bringing OverLord's reign of crime and terror to an end, Dragon is confronted by a horde of reporters. When asked what his plans are now that Chicago's crime boss is dead, Dragon replies with glee that he is going to Disneyland in issue #21.
